instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera detected
threads.message: Hello. So I have on the bench an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that came in because the camera is not being recognized. I tried a known good test screen with another camera but it still says the same thing. I measured for <SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL> and they all seem to be present. I am also getting the I2C voltages at the camera connector. I will say this board has been worked on previously by someone else. the edge bonding is gone from SMC, and J6100 is removed. Any advice would be appreciated. The customer is insistent on having a camera.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera detected
threads.message:
Check L4007/09 first.
Also check data lines in diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera detected
threads.message: L4007/09 Check ok, and I got .415V in diode mode to pins 5 & 6 of camera connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera detected
threads.message:
"I will say this board has been worked on previously by someone else"
Possibly BIOS messed up.
Try FULL new BIOS, clean ME.
You should find some link on the forum.
If not, upload your backup somewhere.
Check if serial number from back cover is the same reported by OSX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No camera detected
threads.message: Ok. I will have to pull SPI rom. I?ll post backup and send link
